items.text: Initial misunderstanding of PCL scope (thought it was just a newsletter and landing page, discovered it's a full 81+ page ecosystem).
Initial plan to download and decompose After Effects/DaVinci templates for video was abandoned as inefficient.
Considered using YouTube URLs → Google AI Studio → effect library → Remotion, but also abandoned.
Risk: Building a simple DAM instead of using ImageKit may require later migration if scaling needs arise.
Risk: LLM cost estimated at ~£70-230/mo per client, baked into price.
Page picker tool built but deprioritized due to generating too many results without prior analysis.
Thumbnail refresh script was backgrounded, only partially completed (2/39 kits).
Risk: Potential coverage gaps in boilerplate mapping after primary kit analysis.
Risk: Unverified differences between Chroma and Real Estate SaaS design systems.
Major Misstep: Built 11 generic, 'AI-looking' React components from scratch instead of converting the actual Brainwave Figma templates, leading to user rejection and wasted time.
Risk: Relying on ever-expanding, unstructured documentation that is not in a database, making context retrieval for LLMs token-prohibitive and untenable.
Risk: Manual, per-frame Figma conversion process is time-consuming; no batch automation exists.
Risk: Potential cost of conversion tools (e.g., Locofy Lightning deemed too expensive with annual billing).
Identified risk: Using RB2B API could lead to them seeing the product and cutting out access.
Identified gap: Company-level ID (like RB2B) is insufficient for B2C contexts like estate agents who need individual inquiry identification.
Stale reference to '38 pillars' was present and needed correction to the canonical 23 pillars for V7.
Risk: Scattered content in bucket folders (Downloads) risks being lost or unsynthesized if not ingested.
MemoryError when reading large files for line/word count - fixed with 10MB size limit and line-by-line reading.
NUL byte ValueError in PostgreSQL INSERT due to binary content in summary/title fields - fixed with sanitize_text() function to strip \x00 bytes.
ChromaDB not installed initially due to dual Python installations (Anaconda 3.13 vs standalone 3.12) - fixed with `python -m pip install chromadb`.
Unicode box-drawing characters in v7_daily.py failed on Windows charmap codec - fixed by replacing with ASCII dashes.
UI library component gap analysis based on unreliable llm_category data from earlier OCR - identified as a data quality issue.
The previous 10-month effort on an 8-component system was identified as a 'mirage' and 'untenable'.
Risk/Bottleneck: No tool exists for automatic batch Figma-to-React conversion from URLs; process is manual and tedious (150-200 conversions).
Bug: `absoluteBoundingBox: null` for some Figma nodes lacking position data. Fix: `node.get("absoluteBoundingBox") or {}`.
Bug: Windows cp1252 encoding error due to Unicode `->` arrow in print statements. Fix: Replaced with ASCII `->`.
Bug: MemoryError on 483MB Befit JSON due to pretty-printing. Fix: Save compact with `separators=(',',':')`.
Bug: Canvas boards (>5000px) incorrectly treated as single screens. Fix: Detect by size and recurse into children.
Bug: Befit Phase 4 PNG export failed due to syntax error with escaped `!=` in inline Python command. Fix pending.
Bug: GitHub push protection triggered by hardcoded Figma token in 4 scripts. Fix: Moved to env var.
Risk: Previous approaches (depth=2 API, AI vision) were unreliable/costly.
Risk: Context loss from not documenting methodologies leads to repeated work.
MemoryError in count_lines_words() - large files caused OOM. Fixed with 10MB limit + line-by-line reading.
NUL byte ValueError in PostgreSQL - binary content in summary field. Fixed with sanitize_text() function.
Unicode encoding error on Windows - box-drawing characters in v7_daily.py. Fixed with ASCII dashes.
Dual Python issue - ChromaDB installed to wrong Python (Anaconda 3.13 vs standalone 3.12). Fixed with python -m pip install chromadb.
UI kit llm_category data is unreliable - OCR analysis produced bad classifications, identified as risk needing redo.
Critical Bug: `absoluteBoundingBox: null` - some Figma nodes lack position data, handled with `or {}.`
Critical Bug: Windows cp1252 encoding - Unicode arrows in print statements cause errors, replaced with ASCII.
Critical Bug: MemoryError on 483MB Befit JSON - compact saves reduce to 130MB.
Critical Bug: Canvas boards (>5000px) treated as screens - added detection to recurse into them.
Risk: System failing to self-adhere to session logging/indexing/rules (noted by John).
Strivo and Travel Planner Light kits failed due to connection errors on full fetch.
Untitled UI Pro kit failed with HTTP 400 (file too large).
Figma rate limit encountered for the Finder kit, blocking PNG export with a Retry-After header of ~4 days.
Page picker tool built prematurely: 500 components per page was overwhelming and useless for user.
Missed context from earlier conversations about kit roles, doubling user's workload by requiring manual review.
Coreik kit mentioned by user but not included in the 38 target kits; risk of missing required components.
Need to verify if Chroma's design system conflicts with Brainwave boilerplate (Inter font for back-end vs. DM Sans for front-end).
Potential for design system mismatch between Chroma and Real Estate SaaS kits (both use DM Sans but may differ in font sizes, etc.).
